nodes.bodyText: If the version of CUDA being used is 8.0 or newer, the -with-gdk option is not necessary.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -719,6 +719,8 @@ bash configure --openjdk-target=${OPENJ9_CC_PREFIX} \
 
 :pencil: **DDR support:** You can build DDR support only on AArch64 Linux.  If you are building in a cross-compilation environment, you need the `--disable-ddr` option.
 
+:pencil: **CUDA support:** You can enable CUDA support if you are building on NVIDIA Jetson Developer Kit series.  Add `--enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda` when you run `configure`.  The path `/usr/local/cuda` may be different depending on the version of JetPack.

nodes.bodyText: The CUDA version is 10.0, but I got an error on undefined GDK_HOME when I ran configure only with --enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -719,6 +719,8 @@ bash configure --openjdk-target=${OPENJ9_CC_PREFIX} \
 
 :pencil: **DDR support:** You can build DDR support only on AArch64 Linux.  If you are building in a cross-compilation environment, you need the `--disable-ddr` option.
 
+:pencil: **CUDA support:** You can enable CUDA support if you are building on NVIDIA Jetson Developer Kit series.  Add `--enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda` when you run `configure`.  The path `/usr/local/cuda` may be different depending on the version of JetPack.

nodes.bodyText:
runtime/makelib/mkconstants.mk.ftl sets GDK_HOME for other platforms but does not for AArch64 Linux.
Can I assume the path /usr/local/cuda as the default path for AArch64 there?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -719,6 +719,8 @@ bash configure --openjdk-target=${OPENJ9_CC_PREFIX} \
 
 :pencil: **DDR support:** You can build DDR support only on AArch64 Linux.  If you are building in a cross-compilation environment, you need the `--disable-ddr` option.
 
+:pencil: **CUDA support:** You can enable CUDA support if you are building on NVIDIA Jetson Developer Kit series.  Add `--enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda` when you run `configure`.  The path `/usr/local/cuda` may be different depending on the version of JetPack.

nodes.bodyText: We should change runtime/compiler/build/toolcfg/common.mk to stop requiring GDK_HOME and only add it to the include path if it is set. With current versions of CUDA it is not required (nvml.h is part of the toolkit).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -719,6 +719,8 @@ bash configure --openjdk-target=${OPENJ9_CC_PREFIX} \

+:pencil: **CUDA support:** You can enable CUDA support if you are building on NVIDIA Jetson Developer Kit series.  Add `--enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda` when you run `configure`.  The path `/usr/local/cuda` may be different depending on the version of JetPack.

nodes.bodyText:
Updated removing --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda from the document.
Waiting for #9801 to be merged.
